## Properties

| **Property**                | **Values**      | **Default**   |
| --------------------------- | --------------- | ------------- |
| Swap content `InstanceSwap` | `Any component` | `Placeholder` |

## Best practises

- Use dropdowns to present a list of options or selections.
- Keep dropdown options concise and easy to scan, avoid very long lists when possible.
- On mobile, prefer native select dropdowns to improve usability.
- Make sure to support keyboard navigation and screen readers for accessibility.

## When to use

{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--color-text-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} When presenting a list of selectable options in a compact space. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--color-text-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} When users need to select one option from a predefined list without overwhelming the interface. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--color-text-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} For focused interactions that temporarily block the main content. <br/><br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M6 6L18 18M6 18L18 6" style={{ stroke: "var(--color-text-negative)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} If displaying a list of selectable options and the number of options is very limited, consider using radio button instead. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M6 6L18 18M6 18L18 6" style={{ stroke: "var(--color-text-negative)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} If users need to compare multiple options at once, use drawer or dialog instead. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M6 6L18 18M6 18L18 6" style={{ stroke: "var(--color-text-negative)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} If frequent selection is required, such as toggling between views, use tab list instead. <br/>

<Note type="info" title="Note">
  Instance swap allows using custom content in a component. Read about the
  feature from [Figma
  learn](https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/5579474826519-Explore-component-properties#h_01G2Q5FYN2ADEDQ3ZSB1KKY8Z0).
</Note>

## Behaviour

Dropdowns expand vertically to reveal a list of selectable options when triggered. They overlay the content without navigating away.
Dropdowns close automatically when an option is selected or when clicked outside the dropdown area.

## Size

Dropdown width typically matches the trigger element but can expand wider to provide better readability.
Height of dropdown adjusts dynamically based on the number of options. Maximum height is set with `max-height` token to enable scrolling when the content overflows.
